data.title: Average Lakes
data.text:
I wasn't particularly impressed with the chain of lakes. Perhaps I'm not fond of nature, but I found the area and the lakes to be uninspiring.

I wouldn't recommend going out of the way to see them.

data.title: Walking
data.text: I love this area of Minneapolis. You can enjoy a walk, run, or bicycle ride around the lakes. In the summer you can rent canoes, kayaks, paddle boards and sailing.  Playgrounds, beach, fishing, picnic areas. Concerts at Lake Harriet. Rose garden is beautiful. Winter you can enjoy ice fishing. All around fun. Restaurants in walking distance. Whole Foods near by.

data.title: One of Minneapolis' gems!
data.text: I have a canoe on the channel between Cedar Lake and Lake of the Isles, and I would highly recommend renting a canoe (or getting in touch with me) and canoeing or kayaking the chain of lakes.  Really, really beautiful place within the city, I can recommend it enough!  Even just walking around the lakes is a wonderful way to interact with a beautiful part of our city.

data.title: Wonderful walk
data.text: Took a walk around one of the larger lakes.  The views were beautiful.  A trail runs around the lakes and it has plenty of seats to stop and rest.  Great area to unwind and recharge the batteries.

data.title: Pretty spot in Minneapolis
data.text: Whether you are walking, biking, running or driving this is one of my favorite places in Minneapolis.

data.title: A Great Way to experience the seasons
data.text: The Chain of Lakes is a great place to experience the seasons in an urban setting.  I have walked and biked around the lakes during all four seasons.  The views of the change from season to season whether across the lakes and up close are better than a post card.  While summer weekends are congested during the week or during the other three seasons the number of people running, biking or just enjoying the out of doors are just enough to let you know you are still in the city.  I try to experience this at least three times a week year round.

data.title: Fun spot with "Lots to do"!
data.text: From biking, hiking or canoeing around the lakes you will get all the exercise you need and enjoy it at the same time! There are sailboats, paddle boats and paddle boards to rent or watch. There's also a great fish eatery with all outdoor seating and good prices for the quality called the "Tin Fish" on Lake Calhoun. Beautiful area with lots of people/dog  watching or walking!

data.title: Amazing pass time during summer
data.text: There are a variety of boats, canoes, etc for renting and spending your time peacefully around the lakes. The access is easy but it can be crowded during holidays.

data.title: Great
data.text: Great for walking, running or biking.  Beautiful views of the lakes.  Boating kayaks and body boards available for the whole family.  Very good food at the Tin Fish!

data.title: Few restrooms and long walks, but I loved it
data.text:
Close enough for a nice walking meeting during a business trip. I loved this area to go walking with a coworker while we discussed upcoming projects. It could really use more restrooms though. 

Also, be prepared to walk around the entire lake to return to your car. There are no shortcuts.

data.title: Idyllic
data.text: Relatives showed off the Chain of Lakes during a relaxing, scenic drive.  You’ll see lots of walkers, joggers, bicyclists, kids, strollers and dogs enjoying nature on paths that circle the lakes or having fun at several beaches.  Sailboats, canoes and kayaks dot the lakes.  It’s just idyllic.  The moneyed set lives in magnificent houses surrounding the lakes and you’ll be amazed that you’re only a few miles from downtown.

data.title: Great venue for exercise and scenery
data.text: The Chain of Lakes is something that makes Minneapolis unique.  This area of several lakes with fabulous sidewalks for biking, running and walking framed by gorgeous houses is a wonderful place to visit.  Plenty of opportunity for activity, or take a bench and watch people!

data.title: One of the Most Beautiful Urban Areas in the US!
data.text:
I have lived around this area all of my life except for when I have lived in other lovely places for short times like Hawaii and New Canaan, CT, Colorado, and the Chain of Lakes area is every bit as lovely as any of these places.
Serene and Monet-esque Lake of the Isles, Westport-like Lake Calhoun, and entirely Minnesotan Lake Harriet.  Each lake has its own vibe, eateries, recreational facilities and locals.  This is what puts Minneapolis on the map!

data.title: First time visit (but not the last)
data.text: First time to MSP- we went on a sunny warm September Sunday. We weren't the only ones there enjoying the beautiful lakes. Lots of folks having picnics, in hammocks, walking, biking, kayaking, SUPing, sailing, sail- boarding. More activities than one can imagine! We rented bikes and biked around several of the lakes for an hour- it was great fun and gave us a chance to see the beautiful lakes and homes quickly. Return visit for sure!

data.title: Perfect Bike Ride
data.text: A highlight of our trip was our bike ride from downtown to the chain of lakes. Highly recommend grabbing a city bike and heading through the neighborhoods around the lake.

data.title: City Parks and Lakes
data.text: Wonderful paths for walking and biking. There are beaches, dog parks, paddle boat rentals, food and drink in the summer. Great part of the city for exercise or relaxation.

data.title: You can find this only two miles from downtown Minneapolis?
data.text: I should tell you to avoid this area, but that is because I live here and want it all to myself.  However, that would be selfish and un-Minnesotan.  So all I have to say is, WOW!  Regardless of whether you walk, run, bike, kayak, sail, SUP or do anything else that suits your fancy, just get out there and enjoy it.  The general rule of thumb is that each lake has a circumference of 3 miles, so you can plot your course from there.  Isles is the best for mansion-viewing, Calhoun the best for people-watching, Harriet my personal fave because of the shade and bandshell, and Cedar the least crowded.  You can add Brownie as a bonus, but it is much smaller and slightly off the grid.  Tin Fish is the perfect place to people watch and enjoy a meal or drink (but be prepared for a slow-moving line), and be sure to check out the daily summer entertainment at Lake Harriet Bandshell.

data.title: Very nice area
data.text: We had breakfast nearby at the Kenwood and drove around the area. One of the nicest areas we saw in Minneapolis! The lakes and gardens are beautiful. The homes are amazing!  Stopped at a park in front of lake Harriet and really enjoyed the garden there

data.title: The crown jewels of Minneapolis parks
data.text: Lake Harriet, Lake Calhoun, Lake of the Isles (plus Cedar Lake and Brownie Lake) are usually among the first things I show to visitors to the Twin Cities. It's just a great way for them to get a peek at what makes Minneapolis so special. When the weather's nice (even if it's cold), you'll see dozens of people walking solo or in groups, pushing strollers, walking their dog, catching up with old friends. And of course, there are roller bladers and bikers, but they have their own pathways for safety sake. You can rent canoes, kayaks and paddleboards in season, or just bring a hammock and read a book. During the summer, the Lake Harriet bandshell holds free concerts in the evening. Don't miss the beautiful Rose and Perennial Garden and Peace Garden in Lyndale Park, adjacent to Lake Harriet.  The lakes are simply an irreplaceable part of the city, so don't miss them.

data.title: Gorgeous No Matter the Season
data.text: There is always something to do here regardless of the season. From long romantic strolls to a healthy, energetic run. One of the prettiest spots in Minneapolis
